definitions.definition: A natural attraction or feeling of kinship to a person or thing.
A family relationship through marriage of a relative (e.g. sister-in-law ), as opposed to consanguinity (e.g. sister ).
A kinsman or kinswoman of a such relationship; one who is affinal .
The fact of and manner in which something is related to another.
Resemblances between biological populations , suggesting that they have a common origin , type or stock .
Structural resemblances between minerals ; resemblances that suggest that they are of a common origin or type.
An attractive force between atoms , or groups of atoms, that contributes towards their forming bonds .
The attraction between an antibody and an antigen
A tendency to keep a task running on the same processor in a symmetric multiprocessing operating system to reduce the frequency of cache misses.

main_definition: A natural attraction or feeling of kinship to a person or thing.
secondary_definitions: A family relationship through marriage of a relative (e.g. sister-in-law ), as opposed to consanguinity (e.g. sister ).
A kinsman or kinswoman of a such relationship; one who is affinal .
The fact of and manner in which something is related to another.
( taxonomy ) Resemblances between biological populations , suggesting that they have a common origin , type or stock .
( geology ) Structural resemblances between minerals ; resemblances that suggest that they are of a common origin or type.
( chemistry ) An attractive force between atoms , or groups of atoms, that contributes towards their forming bonds .
( medicine ) The attraction between an antibody and an antigen
( computing ) A tendency to keep a task running on the same processor in a symmetric multiprocessing operating system to reduce the frequency of cache misses.
( geometry ) An automorphism of affine space .
